title: Business & Finance
text:
The SEC is preparing to propose major changes to the stock market's plumbing as soon as this fall, as it seeks ways to make the market more efficient for small investors and public companies.

---

Kohl's is in advanced talks to be sold to retail holding company Franchise Group in a deal that could value the department-store chain at around $8 billion.

---

JetBlue said it has sweetened its bid for Spirit Airlines , as JetBlue 's effort to wrest the carrier from its planned merger with Frontier enters the final stretch.

---

China is concluding a yearlong probe into ride-hailing company Didi Global and preparing to lift a ban on adding new users.

---

U.S. stocks finished modestly higher, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials rising 0.3%, 0.4% and 0.05%, respectively.

---

Two financial players are suing the LME after the exchange earlier this year suspended nickel trading and canceled some trades following wild swings in the metal's price.

---

Apple introduced software changes that aim to further expand its reach beyond the iPhone, including by boosting its payment system and car connectivity.
